rComments: The Hunger Games course was a blast!  Kinda like a "greatest hits" of psychology but we used the Hunger Games story and characters as a case study to talk about topics like the psych of poverty, propaganda, social status, agency, and more.  Dr. Byrd keeps the class interesting with unique activities (like making films) and lots of class discussion

Dr. Byrd presents a lot of material and really counts on you to read the book and do the rest.  If you go into class prepared and ready to engage, its easy to keep up... but not reading or missing lectures would make it very challenging to understand the material (DUH).  She's fair, interesting, and thought provoking to learn from.

Dr. Byrd is unfortunately one of the least inspirationalunprepared teachers I have ever had as a student. Dr. Byrd is a nice individual, but placed in a teachers role, the classroom environment is similar to the "Bueller Scenario". It's ironic that the subject is titled "Education Psychology", because she is not capable of teaching effectively.
